par.text: Promethium is a silvery-white metal belonging to the lanthanide group. It was artificially produced in 1947 by Charles du Bois Coryell, Jacob Marinsky and Lawrence Glendenin. The existence of the element was predicted as early as 1912. In chemical properties promethium resembles neodymium. It reacts with oxygen to produce promethium(III) oxide - P
. In reaction with nitrogen, promethium(III) nitride - PmN - is produced, in reaction with chlorine - promethium(III) chloride, PmC
. Promethium salts are radioactive, they glow in the dark with a pale-blue or yellowish-green light. Promethium is an unstable element. Its longest-lived isotope is promethium-147 with a half-life
= 17.7 years, while the least stable isotope, promethium-140, has a half-life of 2 seconds. The element was named after the Greek Titan, Prometheus.
